entities: United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC)
summary:
The Security Council,

Recalling its previous resolutions on Afghanistan, particularly resolution 2041 (2012) which extended the mandate of UNAMA until 23 March 2013,

Reaffirms its strong commitment to Afghanistan's sovereignty, independence, territorial integrity, and national unity.

The Council reiterates support for the Transition (Inteqal) process, which involves Afghanistan assuming full responsibility in the security sector and emphasizes the importance of a comprehensive approach to address security, economic, governance, and development challenges.

The Council welcomes the International Afghanistan Conference in Bonn and its conclusions, as well as the declaration of a Decade of Transformation (2015-2024).

The Council also welcomes the strategic consensus between Afghanistan and the International Community on a renewed partnership for this Transformation Decade.

The Council reaffirms its support for the implementation of commitments set out in the London and Kabul Conference Communiqués, the Afghanistan National Development Strategy (ANDS), and the National Drugs Control Strategy.

The Council stresses the crucial importance of advancing regional cooperation to promote security, stability, and economic and social development in Afghanistan.

The Council welcomes regional initiatives such as the Istanbul Process, quadrilateral and trilateral summits, and the efforts of organizations like the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO), the Collective Security Organization (CSTO), and the South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation (SAARC).
The Security Council:

Commends the outcome of the Heart of Asia Ministerial Conference, held in Kabul on 14 June 2012, and looks forward to the next meeting in Almaty on 26 April 2013, aiming to strengthen regional security and cooperation for a secure and stable Afghanistan.

Welcomes the outcome of the International Conference on the Solutions Strategy for Afghan Refugees, held in Geneva on 2 and 3 May 2012, and looks forward to the implementation of the joint communiqué.

Stresses the central and impartial role of the United Nations in promoting peace and stability in Afghanistan, and expresses appreciation for the efforts of the Secretary-General, his Special Representative, and UNAMA.
